title: Netanyahu Optimistic on Hostage Release by Oct. 13 Amid Gaza Ceasefire Talks
snippets: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that he hopes Hamas will have returned all remaining hostages by Oct. 13.
Hamas agreed to release the hostages and to the idea of handing over governing Gaza to Palestinian technocrats, but did not give a clear response to many other elements.
Hamas accepted parts of US President Trump’s 20-point Gaza ceasefire plan but wants more talks on several key points.

Hamas said it would release all Israeli hostages but wants to negotiate elements of President Trump’s peace plan for Gaza. Adam Rasgon, a reporter for The New York Times in Jerusalem, explains where negotiations stand.
Israel and Hamas said they would work with President Trump’s plan to end the war, but a number of sticking points could derail efforts to reach a diplomatic breakthrough.
US president warns militant group that it has limited time to seal a deal to end the conflict
Israel and Hamas announced they’ve agreed to parts of Trump’s plan to end the war.
titles: Trump urges Hamas to 'move quickly' on Gaza peace plan
Shock in Gaza as Trump appears to welcome Hamas response to US peace plan
What we know about Hamas’ response to Trump’s Gaza peace plan
Hamas Partially Accepts Trump’s Peace Plan
Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan: What to Know
Trump tells Hamas to ‘move quickly’ on hostage deal
Trump Warns Hamas ‘Must Move Quickly’ To Release Hostages As Part Of His Peace Plan
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu expressed hope for the release of all hostages by Hamas by Oct. 13, following partial agreement to President Trump's 20-point Gaza ceasefire plan. While Hamas has agreed to release hostages and discuss governing Gaza with Palestinian technocrats, negotiations on several aspects of the plan remain. Both Israel and Hamas have shown willingness to work towards ending the conflict, but unresolved issues could impede a diplomatic breakthrough. The US President has cautioned Hamas about the limited time available to finalize the deal.

title: ANO Party Wins Czech Elections; Babiš Eyes Policy Shift on Ukraine
snippets: His political comeback put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and toward Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.
With most votes tallied, Babis’s ANO party is ahead, but it appears set to fall short of a majority in parliament.

With Babiš’s victory the Czech Republic looks set to join Hungary and Slovakia in refusing support for Ukraine

The populist billionaire Andrej Babiš has won the Czech Republic parliamentary elections, preliminary results show, but fallen short of the overall majority.

This win marks a
The party of Andrej Babis, a billionaire and a skeptic of military support to Ukraine, prevailed in parliamentary elections by focusing on the economy.

Czech billionaire Andrej Babis was on track to return to power after securing a decisive victory in a parliamentary election, pledging to undo four years of austerity and curb military aid to Ukraine.
titles: Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech parliamentary election
Populist billionaire Andrej Babis’s party set to win Czech election
Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech parliamentary election
Andrej Babis Likely to Return as Czech Prime Minister After Parliamentary Win
Czech Billionaire Set to Return to Power After Election Win
summary: Andrej Babiš's ANO party won the Czech Republic parliamentary elections, according to preliminary results. Despite the victory, ANO did not achieve an overall majority. Babiš's win signals a shift in the Czech Republic's foreign policy, aligning closer with Hungary and Slovakia's stance of limiting support for Ukraine. This marks a significant political comeback for the billionaire, who aims to reverse austerity measures and reduce military aid to Ukraine.

title: Trump Administration Deploys 300 National Guard to Illinois After Dispute
snippets: The controversial move follows protests over ramped-up immigration enforcement and the shooting of a woman during unrest on Saturday.
Trump deploys 300 National Guard troops to Chicago amid protests and criticism from local leaders.
Trump is deploying 300 troops to Chicago as part of his immigration and crime crackdown. But a similar order for Portland has been temporarily blocked.

Illinois governor JB Pritzker says administration is escalating ‘aggression against Illinois citizens and residents’

Donald Trump has moved to deploy the national guard in another city by authorizing 300 troops to protect federal officers and assets in Chicago, where the government said bor

“This morning, the Trump Administration’s Department of War gave me an ultimatum: call up your troops, or we will,” Pritzker said in a statement.

summary: After a dispute, the Trump Administration authorized 300 National Guard members to be deployed. This decision followed an ultimatum to Illinois Governor Pritzker from the Department of War, stating he must call up troops or the federal government would intervene.

title: Kirk Powers Blue Jays to 10-1 Win Over Yankees in ALDS Opener
snippets: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. said goodbye to a slump in his opening at-bat Saturday. Alejandro Kirk used his first swing to show that his bat remained as hot as ever.
Alejandro Kirk had his second straight two-homer game to power the Toronto Blue Jays to a 10-1 rout of the New York Yankees in Game 1 of their American League Division Series on Saturday.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxQYVpvT0FtNE03Z3lmNmwzdHNYWlVLN3RONndyc29jUjZQUGxlQUFPMzZ2aUlfcm95dWltRUFwMEVNaU9JTFdXUll0dWhHSnh1dEtaZHNSYVdzaFVmTVBNbnFta1B2b0pUSWN6TDhpS1hyNXYtcEhmZDlsQWl6a2JNNHZnLUZqeERJVWc?oc=5" target="_blank">Blue Jays Make Decision on Bo Bichette f

Between Vladimir Guerrero Jr. delivering a major moment, erasing a playoff losing streak and forcing the Yankees to burn through five relievers, the Blue Jays nearly checked every box in Saturday’s win.
The Toronto Blue Jays will have to wait a little longer for Bo Bichette to make his return to the lineup.

The Blue Jays have won 10-1 in Game 1 of the American League Division Series against the New York Yankees. The two teams were playing at Rogers Centre on Saturday for the first game between Toronto and New York in the MLB playoffs. The Yankees and Jays go back to the Rogers Centre in Game […]
titles: Blue Jays open ALDS with blowout win over Yankees
Blue Jays dump Yankees 10-1 in series opener
Blue Jays Make Decision on Bo Bichette for ALDS Matchup vs. Yankees - Sports Illustrated
Blue Jays overpower Yankees to open ALDS with statement win
Blue Jays’ Bo Bichette ruled out of ALDS against Yankees
Blue Jays win 10-1 in Game 1 of ALDS vs. Yankees
summary: Alejandro Kirk led the Toronto Blue Jays to a 10-1 victory over the New York Yankees in Game 1 of their American League Division Series with his second consecutive two-homer game. This win marks the Blue Jays' first post-season victory in nine years, highlighted by a strong performance from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and effective strategy that exhausted the Yankees' bullpen, utilizing five relievers.

title: UFC 320: 'Poatan', 'The Machine' Win; Pereira Reclaims Light Heavyweight Title
snippets: The main and co-main events of UFC 320 delivered masterful performances.
'Poatan' and 'The Machine' each added another name to a growing hit list on Saturday night
Five biggest takeaways from UFC 320, including what's next for Pereira after his spectacular win over Ankalaev to reclaim the UFC light heavyweight title.

summary: At UFC 320, 'Poatan' and 'The Machine' secured victories in their respective main and co-main events, showcasing impressive performances. Additionally, Pereira won against Ankalaev, reclaiming the UFC light heavyweight title. The event highlighted the fighters' growing prowess and discussed potential future matchups following their wins.

title: Collier Cancels Meeting with WNBA Commissioner Amid Dispute
snippets: Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier has canceled her meeting with WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert next week, sources told ESPN.
Engelbert claimed there were inaccuracies in Collier's fiery tirade against WNBA leadership

Minnesota forward Napheesa Collier canceled a meeting with WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert expected to take place next week, a person familiar with the situation told The Associated Press on Saturday night.

summary: Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier has canceled a planned meeting with WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert, according to sources. This decision follows Engelbert's claims of inaccuracies in Collier's critical comments about WNBA leadership.

title: Poland Activates Jets and Air Defenses Amid Ukraine Border Concerns
snippets: Ukraine's neighbour Poland and Nato scrambled fighter jets to ensure the safety of Polish airspace.
Warsaw says ground-based air defence, radar reconnaissance systems also brought to the 'highest state of readiness'.
Poland's armed forces announced mobilizing planes and putting ground defenses on high alert, especially in areas close to the Ukrainian border. Follow DW for more.
titles: Poland scrambles jets as Russia strikes western Ukraine
Poland deploys air defences as Russia launches new strikes on Ukraine
Ukraine updates: Poland scrambles jets to secure airspace
summary: Poland, a neighbor to Ukraine and NATO member, activated its fighter jets and heightened ground-based air defenses and radar systems to the maximum readiness level to secure its airspace. This mobilization, particularly focused along the Ukrainian border, was part of Poland's response to ensure national security. Follow DW for updates.

title: Mark Sanchez Arrested, Hospitalized After Indianapolis Fight
snippets: Former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez arrested and hospitalised after Indianapolis stabbing - Sanchez, who currently works as an analyst for Fox Sports, was arrested for his role in the incident and is in a stable condition in hospital
Mark Sanchez, the former NFL quarterback and current Fox Sports analyst, is in a stable condition after reportedly being stabbed early Saturday morning in Indianapolis.
Former NFL quarterback and current Fox Sports analyst Mark Sanchez was arrested Saturday after he was apparently stabbed in an overnight altercation in downtown Indianapolis.
titles: Former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez arrested and hospitalised after Indianapolis stabbing
Former NFL quarterback Sanchez in stable condition after being stabbed
Mark Sanchez hospitalized, facing multiple charges after stabbing incident
summary: Former NFL quarterback and Fox Sports analyst Mark Sanchez was arrested and charged with battery following a fight in downtown Indianapolis that occurred shortly after midnight on Saturday. The altercation resulted in Sanchez being hospitalized with stab wounds. While details of the incident remain unclear, and Sanchez has not yet been booked in detention, Indianapolis police have confirmed his arrest.

title: Pereira Wins UFC Light Heavyweight Title in 80 Seconds at UFC 320
snippets: Alex Pereira won back the light heavyweight title with a technical knockout of Magomed Ankalaev at UFC 320 in Las Vegas.
Alex Pereira is the champion of the light heavyweights again after crushing Magomed Ankalaev in 80 seconds of Round 1 on Saturday at UFC 320.

Brazilian Alex Pereira scored a stunning first-round knockout win over Magomed Ankalaev to reclaim the UFC light heavyweight title at UFC 320 on Saturday night, with Merab Dvalishvili retaining his bantamweight crown in the co-main event.
titles: UFC 320: Pereira stuns Ankalaev with TKO to regain light heavyweight title
Pereira reclaims title in 80-second TKO of Ankalaev
Pereira dethrones Ankalaev to reclaim light heavyweight belt at UFC 320
summary: Alex Pereira reclaimed the UFC light heavyweight title with a first-round technical knockout victory over Magomed Ankalaev at UFC 320 in Las Vegas. The fight concluded in just 80 seconds, marking a significant win for the Brazilian fighter. In the same event, Merab Dvalishvili retained his bantamweight title.

title: Netanyahu Vows Quick Hostage Return, Sends Team to Egypt for Gaza Plan Talks
snippets: Hamas will disarm "the easy way or the hard way", Israel's PM says after the group gave its response to a peace plan.

Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu said he wants to see hostages returned in the coming days. He also said a team has been sent to Egypt "to finalize technical details" of Trump's plan for the future of Gaza.
Both sides have reacted positively to a United States proposal for a cease-fire, but many details remain to be ironed out, including whether Hamas will disarm.
titles: Netanyahu says he hopes to announce hostage release in the 'coming days'
Netanyahu hopes Gaza hostages return home in coming days
Netanyahu Says Israel and Hamas Are on the Brink of a Hostage Deal
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu announced intentions to secure the return of hostages within days and has dispatched a team to Egypt to conclude technical aspects of Trump's Gaza plan. The hostages' families express cautious optimism, urging the government to seize this chance for resolution.

title: Brewers' Chourio Exits NLDS Game 1 with Hamstring Issue

title: Police Use Force on Protesters at Georgian Presidential Palace
snippets: Opposition protests turned violent as riot police used tear gas and water cannon after disputed local elections.
Demonstrators were trying to enter the presidential palace in Tbilisi. A former president had called on Georgians to protest for what he called the "last chance" to save the country.

TBILISI, Georgia (AP) — Police in Georgia used water cannons and pepper spray on Saturday to push back protesters who tried to storm the presidential palace, as the South Caucasus country held a municipal election boycotted by the main opposition blocs amid a sweeping crackdown on dissent. Ten
titles: Police fire water cannon at Georgia protesters near presidential palace
Georgia: Police fire tear gas at anti-government protesters
Georgia’s police use water cannons to push back protesters trying to storm presidential palace
summary: In Tbilisi, Georgia, police deployed water cannons and pepper spray to repel protesters attempting to storm the presidential palace following a municipal election. The demonstrations, which turned violent, were part of opposition protests against the election results, viewed as the "last chance" to save the country according to a former president. The main opposition blocs had boycotted the election, citing a crackdown on dissent.

title: Judge Blocks Trump's Order to Deploy National Guard in Portland
snippets: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered over the objections of local leaders.
A federal judge has temporarily blocked President Donald Trump’s attempt to federalize and deploy the Oregon National Guard to Portland.
titles: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump's National Guard deployment to Portland
Judge temporarily blocks Trump's attempt to deploy Oregon National Guard to Portland
summary: A federal judge has temporarily halted President Trump's order to deploy the National Guard to Portland, Oregon, against local leaders' wishes. This decision stops the federalization and deployment of the Oregon National Guard to address unrest in Portland.

Canada Post union says latest contract offer is a ‘major step backwards’
summary: The union for Canada Post workers criticized the corporation's latest contract offers as a "mockery of the collective bargaining process" and a "major step back." They expressed disappointment in a statement released Friday.

title: UK Grants Police New Powers After Pro-Palestinian Protest Arrests
snippets: Officers will be able to tell organisers to move demonstrations if protests have caused "repeated disorder".

Move follows arrest of almost 500 people at latest pro-Palestinian demonstration in London on Saturday

Ministers are to give police new powers to target repeated protests, aimed particularly at cracking down on demonstrations connected to Gaza, the Home Office has said.

The announceme
titles: Police to get broader powers to restrict repeated protests
Police to get new powers to crack down on repeated protests, says Home Office
summary: The UK Home Office announced new police powers to move demonstrations that cause "repeated disorder," following the arrest of nearly 500 people at a pro-Palestinian protest in London. These measures specifically aim to address protests related to Gaza.

title: Three States Ban Coldrif Syrup After Deaths, Toxic Solvent Found
snippets: Three states ban the cough syrup after children die allegedly after consuming the product.
The Indian Health Ministry said in a statement that test samples of Coldrif cough syrup found a highly toxic industrial solvent. At least nine children died allegedly after consuming it.
titles: India probes possible cough syrup link to deaths of at least nine children
India: 3 states ban cough syrup after several children die
summary: Three states have banned Coldrif cough syrup after the Indian Health Ministry found a toxic industrial solvent in test samples. Nine children have reportedly died after consuming the product.

title: Security Fears Exclude Three Provinces from Election, Sparking Debate
snippets: Three provinces will not be included "for security reasons", amid concerns over how representative the polls will be.
Supporters argue the vote could be a milestone for the country, but critics say it is a divisive move by President Ahmed al-Shara to consolidate power.

summary: Three provinces are excluded from upcoming polls in an unnamed country due to security concerns, raising doubts about the election's representativeness. While supporters see the vote as a potential milestone, critics view it as President Ahmed al-Shara's attempt to strengthen his power.

title: Japan Set to Welcome First Female Prime Minister Inspired by Thatcher
snippets: The conservative politician, who sees Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, is set to be Japan's first female prime minister.
Ms. Takaichi would be Japan’s first female prime minister in a country where women are drastically underrepresented at the highest levels of power.
titles: Who is Japan's 'Iron Lady' Sanae Takaichi?
Sanae Takaichi Is Likely to Be Japan’s Next Leader. Who Is She?
summary: A conservative politician inspired by Margaret Thatcher is poised to become Japan's first female prime minister. This marks a significant milestone in a country where women are significantly underrepresented in top political positions.

title: OpenAI's Sora App Features Copyrighted Characters, Signals IP Strategy Shift
snippets: CNBC has seen videos of characters from shows like "SpongeBob SquarePants" on the platform and was able to independently generate other characters.
OpenAI may be reversing course on how it approaches copyright and intellectual property in its new video app Sora.
titles: AI Sam Altman and the Sora copyright gamble: 'I hope Nintendo doesn't sue us'
Sam Altman says Sora will add ‘granular,’ opt-in copyright controls
summary: OpenAI's new video app Sora, as observed by CNBC, features characters from copyrighted shows like "SpongeBob SquarePants." This development suggests that OpenAI might be changing its approach to copyright and intellectual property rights in its applications.
